page.title: 03 INDUSTRY-BURGHFIELD
page.content: The A.R.C. dig fields and extract gravel fom underneath. The gravel is flint from millions of years ago. The gravel is seperated into different sizes. The company gets the landowners permission to work on that bit of land. At first they drill a hole to see if the gravel is the right sort. If it is they drain all the water from underneath the field and then dig up the whole field and get the gravel out. After they've got it all out they either put the field back like it was or make it into a lake. It is estimated that in 2010 AD ll the gravel from this area will have run out. While they extract gravel wild animals lose their homes, but fish stocks are introduced into the lakes.
